p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;
p.seg: Letter not found. The text given here is from a full-page article, 'The jubilee year of the

30 May 1891, p. 688. Following a short history, the page consists of congratulatory statements from other journals, with a small number from individuals. The page was reprinted in a number of later issues. The letter is dated to April as the latest that it could have been sent. The latest dated message is from '
, Paris, March 20, 1891', which is consistent with a date of April for M's letter, although it is possible that he sent it much earlier.
Let me offer my best felicitation on the semi- centenary jubilee of your splendid
, which you have edited with so much talent, knowledge, and discrimination, for so long a while as the worthy successor of the great Lindley. Wishing the
also in future a splendid success under your able leadership, I remain,

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-style: italic;
